data.title: Maseru (district (national))
data.text:
Scope and Contents

Africans in European dress on a verandah, including Lerotholi Letsie (1835-1905), Paramount Chief from 1891, and Jonathan Molapo (c.1844-1928), grandson of Moshoeshoe, second to the Paramount Chief. Father of Leabua Jonathan, Prime Minister of Lesotho.

Scope and Contents

205 x 154 mm. A view from the street showing the front fa√ßade of the post office at Maseru, capital of Lesotho, with a row of cars parked in the foreground.

Scope and Contents

128 x 80 mm. Showing an unidentified stone building set in a landscape of deep snow. The building (with the Union Jack flying from a mast in front of the house) is possibly the British Residency. The snowfall of the winter of 1964 was the heaviest in living memory in Maseru.

Scope and Contents

156 x 108 mm. Showing the buildings of the three-nation university at Roma. Originally the Pins XII Catholic University College, the non-denominational university came into existence on January 1 1964. With the change of name of two of the participating states, it later became the University of Botswana, Lesotho and Swaziland (U.B.L.S.). The Roma Campus was nationalized in October 1975 and thenceforward became the National University of Lesotho.
